body.name: Amazon Basics Oval Nonelectrical Bidet Toilet Seat with Self-cleaning, Elongated, Slow Close, White, 19.5" x 14.4" x 3.4"

deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 14 hrs 7 mins
features: Toilet seat bidet with automatic cleaning; works with water pressure (no electronics); suitable for seniors and children
Includes a standard non-electric white bidet seat with an elongated shape (vs. round) and non-corrosive nuts and bolts
Adjustable water pressure with a simple turn of the knob
No-slam seat and lid automatically lower slowly and quietly
Smooth,tenancity, not easy to be broken.
Simple to install and removes conveniently for cleaning or replacing

reviews.reviewerName: Does not allow for fingerprint unlock
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely worth it to purchase.
reviews.reviewText: I've been really impressed with this toilet bidet – it works exceptionally well. I've come across other bidets with less effective designs, especially when it comes to the cleanliness of the sprayer. However, this bidet is different as it doesn't have that issue. I appreciate that it offers separate settings for both the back and front, providing a personalized experience. Not to mention, with the toilet paper scarcity in 2020, this bidet has been a real cost-saver. It's an efficient and hygienic alternative that has reduced my reliance on toilet paper significantly

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Like a pressure washer for your bum!
reviews.reviewText: This was my first introduction to the world of bidets. Price was right. Install was pretty easy. Fitting goes on tank inlet not on the wall shutoff. Had trouble with leaking initially but it was resolved by replacing the flat washer that came in the package with a more cone shaped one I had laying around. Works very well. This thing has good pressure, so be careful!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars WARNING, DO NOT MOVE MORE THAN TWO DOTS!
reviews.reviewText: If you move it past the first two dots then it will engage pressure washer mode where it could probably do some real damage. Now if you keep it within those first two dots then it has decent pressure, easy to install, cheap, functional, & over all a good product.Great for overweight people who have excess on the sides due to being wider than most. My roommate busted the last one because it stuck out too far & was too thin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Awesome bidet, uncomfortable seat
reviews.reviewText: The product images provided don’t show what you actually sit upon to use the bidet. It is much more narrow, and depending on your body type, quite possibly uncomfortable for any amount of time let alone long periods of time. No, you should not sit for a while. But if you have diverticulitis or other issues that cause you to visit this frequently and for long periods of time, you will want something comfortable. I have been using this about two weeks now, and I am a fan of the bidet. But the super narrow seat, beyond being uncomfortable, which is a big deal, also does not fit the rim of the elongated bowl. Additionally, there are two options for securing it to the toilet bowl, however, the typical boats will not work with mine for the set up. Because of this, the seat will not stay in one place and continually moves in use. Not enough that you are sliding off, but more than you want in a toilet seat, typically. This can make it difficult to open and as a cis male also stand in front of the toilet throughout the day. If it sounds like, I don’t like it, the aesthetics of its use are still less important to me than the results from its use. And the results are pretty positive overall.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: There are 2 items on the listing, this review is for the Amazon Basics Nonelectrical Bidet Toilet Seat with Self-cleaning, Elongated, Slow Close.The bidet works great but the seat is so thin that it's uncomfortable to sit on.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I recently installed this bidet attachment to my toilet and I only wish I had discovered it sooner. It has significantly enhanced my daily routine, offering a level of convenience and cleanliness that has made life much easier

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Instruction are wrong
reviews.reviewText: Instruction for the valve install are wrong as these will not fit on the small thread of the water outlet from the wall. The silicone piece where it suppose to go also was not correctly located. have to do a little "reverse engineer" in term of putting the silicone washer in the bigger hose to stop the leak. at the end of the day it work. more elbow grease than expected. Instruction written by R&D but never bother to R&D.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I feel like I was living in the stone age before getting this. Also be wary of the installation
reviews.reviewText: I almost unnecessarily went to hardware store to buy things I didn't need. You DON'T have to install the T-Valve where it shows in the manual, look up Youtube videos on basic Bidet installation and you'll see that its done on the bottom of your toilets tank, not on the incoming water line sticking out of the wall like this manual says. This made the hose size work for me. All else you will need is Teflon tape, and even that is kinda optional to be honest. Oh and some pliers/crescent wrenchRegarding its use, I love it and its one of those things I said to myself why didn't I buy this earlier. The spray for me was super strong, I barely have to turn the knob to the lowest setting because high is way to hard, and now I feel much cleaner much faster and save on toilet paper.

the item is just what fits the situation since the garbage bin has to sit on the right side and this one ordered from Amazon Basic has a simple design that everything is on the far back without causing interferences. The product installation guide is a bit misleading, as some had complained about the unfit fitting issues. Perhaps the one who wrote the guide do not understand the bathroom plumbing very well. The Tee provided should be connected with the fitting from the tank, which is somewhat standard 7/8" in diameter, not from the inlet(3/8") as illustrated on the guide unless you want to buy addition fitting to connect the inlet valve. The finishing of the installation does leave a relatively larger gap between the seat and the base that equals to the thickness of the bidet, which is around 0.4". The seat will be tilted to the front unless you fit additional bumps underneath the seat. There are more fancy models that claim to be thinner and/or gapless. And this one just fits the application better overall. And also it costs much less :) you can always find good stuffs here at the Amazon Basic. Thanks for the fast delivery by the way!
I mean for the price you can't go wrong with this one. Works very well, almost a little to well on higher settings lol

This item is easy to install and works well...the only problem I had was it didn't fit onto our existing water shut-off in our bathroom....but the needed part was easy to find at the hardware store ...but I felt it should have been supplied ...it did come with one but not the standard size for use in Canada

Very good quality for the price. I was hesitant to try an Amazon-special for less than $60 when brand name models sell for $150 or more but this was a great deal. The seat doesn't quite fit as well as the AmericanStnd which came with my toilet (we have the elongated, and it could have been another centimeter or so longer) but for the price and quality, I'm NOT complaining. Soft-close works great too.

I bought this one because it didn't have a handle that was sticking forward. The installation was simple enough and nothing has leaked yet. The raise in height of the back of the seat hasn't bothered me, but it is pretty thick at 0.4". The issue I have with it is that there is no pressure control. The knob allows for turning up to 90°, but at 5° it's at max pressure. It's basically an on/off switch.
